an7.39:1.1: “Mendicants, having seven qualities, Sāriputta realized the four kinds of textual analysis and lives having achieved them with his own insight.
an7.39:1.3: It’s when Sāriputta truly understood: ‘This is mental sluggishness’.
an7.39:1.4: He truly understood internally constricted mind as ‘internally constricted mind’.
an7.39:1.5: He truly understood externally scattered mind as ‘externally scattered mind’.
an7.39:1.6: He knew feelings, perceptions, and thoughts as they arose, as they remained, and as they went away.
an7.39:1.9: The patterns of qualities—suitable or unsuitable, inferior or superior, or those on the side of dark or bright—were properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.
an7.39:1.10: Having these seven qualities, Sāriputta realized the four kinds of textual analysis and lives having achieved them with his own insight.”
